intro: Lagenandra undulata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it an attractive ornamental plant.
